name: River Palms Resort Casino

reviews.text: I just returned from a 3 day weekend in Laughlin, and by far staying at the River Palms has to top one of my worst hotel experiences ever. If you're up for a dirty room, poor service and oh having to wait for 4 hours after check in to actually get your room, this is the place. We booked a parlor suite (2 bedrooms with a sitting area in the middle) more than a month prior to our arrival. When we arrive we were told at check in that the parlor may still need to be cleaned but if so call right down and it would be taken care of. So we trek it up to the 23rd floor (all the while with a senior in a wheelchair) and find our key cards do not work. Only the key to the parlor gained us access. This by the way was dirty. So we call the front desk and of course we get instructions on how to use the key card...well we were in one of the rooms so obviously we were not total morons. They send up the tech to check the locks. We get access to one room and find the other is still occupied. So we call down to the front desk, again. And are told they would be happy to move us to another room. We explain that will not do since again, we have someone in a wheelchair and we need a shared room. Well, none available. Okay after being on the phone with them and being told nothing they could do until they locate the other guest, as they could not move their things, even though they should have been checked out at 11AM, it's now 5:30 PM (oh and another tidbit, they "technically" as they explained have until 5:30 to have the room cleaned).
reviews.title: Horrible - Take reviews of low ratings seriously

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So down the 23 floors I go to the front desk. And bypass the line to the counter. Explain the issue and the clerk tells me "oh this is unacceptable” well you don't say. So he says we can take care of that, but of course when I explain it's a suite, no go. He heads behind the door to the back office. Another 15 -20 minutes later he emerges with the supervisor Trish and they head to the other end of the counter, leaving me with still no communication of what will be done. Okay another 10 - 15 minutes or so they head my way. Trish tells me they've located the guest he is moving out now and they apologize for the issue...and the room will be cleaned ASAP (right). I push and get dinner buffet comps. Whoopee, okay it's now 6:30ish and we head to the buffet, wait another 30 minutes. Eat, gross, glad it was free and head up to the room. Surprise...it's not clean. Check with the current maid on the floor, sorry no English and we are not on the list to be cleaned. Back down the 23 floors we go...straight to the counter and of course the response "oh unacceptable". So they'll have it cleaned within 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Need to print a new Schedule!
hotel needs help
reviews.text: Instead of opting to enjoy the casino we head up to make sure we get clean sheets. That was a good choice as the beds were made and when I asked about clean sheets the maid said no, same people. No not same. Well we decided it best to sit in the parlor with the door open to the room and have a glass of wine (no room service we brought our own) and enjoy the "the cleaning channel" aka watch the maid clean the room. So we were in Laughlin for about 4 hours before we were "technically" checked in. Which of course I was told at the front desk, well you are checked in, I said technically, but not physically. All in all you're better off going to Las Vegas and deal with the crowds. Laughlin is old, worn out, customer service is unheard of and the hotel "this hotel" is horrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last note, we passed 2 more guests in the elevator who had the exact same issue, given a room that was already occupied
reviews.title: Don't miss the mystery spot

reviews.text: Was very nice, but need more people at check in desk, to move travelers signing in. Had to stand in line about 25 minutes. Hotel has a printed pamplet in room, showing times and hour, of which a 1/3 was incorrect, places were closed (forever) times of openings and closings were wrong on some. It is annoying to go to a place and find they are closed. The breakfast buffet has really improved, but no more service help, you have to get your coffee and juice or water yourself, and it is in a corner, outside the food area, you have to carry that back to your table. you have put in sugar & cream at the area , where you get the drinks. The hotel is very clean, I checked my bed for you know what. The service people are very nice and helpful. We played Bingo, the people running the game were sweet and helpful. We had the $2.99 special (Hashbrowns, sausage, bacon ,eggs, toast.) at the the cafe but coffee was an added $1.75. The buffet was 6.99 with all kinds of breakfast food, it is a better value, they will make eggs any way you want. They need an early opening and late closing coffee shop, "Java Joe" was closed twice when we went according to the schedule.
reviews.title: nice

reviews.text: Stayed Jan 2 and 3 with tour group. Room was large with comfortable beds. We were on the backside overlooking the river. Nice view.
reviews.title: Decent room, comfortable bed

likes.disliked: — no in-room coffee, internet pricing terrible.

reviews.text: Only complaint is there are no in-room coffee pots. You have to go to one of the restaurants to get coffee or tea.
reviews.title: Can't Wait To Come Back!

likes.liked: — The room was huge and great views

reviews.text: Buffet is not worth the price, small cafe in lower level great for breakfast. They run specials, we paid $2.22 per person the first morning and $1.99 per person the next.
reviews.title: River Slums!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Subway on site was great for light eats. We don't gamble so can't remark about the Casino itself, other than it seemed busy.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, nice room, good entertainment..... tight slots

likes.liked: — Large room and clean... friendly staff!

reviews.text: Located at one end of the strip, it's a 15 minute walk to the local outlet mall.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the River Palms

likes.disliked: — would have liked more fast food or snack areas

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice and both visits were about the same. The prices those weekends were when River Palms was offering rooms much cheaper than the other places. The rooms are upgraded and look nice at first, but the celing looked like it had never seen paint since the day the place was built, which took away from the look. Check in was okay, but a little slow. The elevators were a bit of a problem as there was a huge tour group that was filling up every elevator for quite a while.
reviews.title: Okay to stay here, but only if it's the best price offered

reviews.text: There was no major issue, though we actually had gone to other casinos for our meals and entertainment. The view was beautiful from our upper floor.
reviews.title: friendliest staff
River Palms Stay Laughlin
reviews.text: The look is a bit dated, but not an awful place. But, if prices are comparable, most places in Laughlin are nicer.

The casino hotel is on the Colorado River. The pool is super clean and over looks the river. The grass area is like a carpet, what a great place to go for a nice walk. Every staff member I met from check-in to the security to the housekeepers were very nice and had a big smile for us. The seafood buffet was the best ever and a great value at $9.95. I never ate so much crab in my life. I am still drooling thinking about it. The rooms were a little dated but clean and quite large. The shower didn't have alot of pressure but well how dirty can one get...
reviews.title: Relaxing Atmosphere and Perfect Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed at the River Palms in Laughlin. We received a remolded room and found it very nice. Hotel is going through some changes as some restaurants are closed. We liked our stay there very much. Good free entertainment.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Casino in Laughlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel to Laughlin several times a year, We always stay at the River Palms and always have had a clean, fresh room. In May of 2008 we went for a solt tourement just after my husband broke some ribs, the housekeeping staff was great providing extra pillows and blankets so that he could rest in a chair. We had booked for four niight but only stayed two, the front desk staff was so understanding.
reviews.title: Always Stay At River Palms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In October we met friends from NY there for four days -- they couldn't believe how nice and friendly the staff was.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.text: We'll be back to River Palms in December for my birthday.
reviews.title: Crying Shame this hotel is

likes.disliked: — Horrible rooms, especially the BEDS !!! No fitted sheet, OLD linens and towels, UGH - and dirty/sticky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Always enjoy our stays.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel EVER!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason I gave it "ok" rating instead of "terrible" is because the staff on the casino floor was very nice and helpful. Otherwise, our room was dirty, the sheets didn't fit the bed, the walls were stained with something that they could have been very easily wiped clean, the staff at the VIP room were very indifferent when we voiced our opinion. Bathrooms could have been cleaner. Next time we will try another hotel.
reviews.title: Never Again!

description: Casino resort with an ice rink for an ice skating revue.
